list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor Tenable WAS client with class-based structure
Reorganized the Tenable WAS client to use a class-based design, encapsulating API methods within the `TenableClient` class for better modularity and reusability. Enhanced input validation, headers handling, and documentation formatting. Updated `README.md` and version to reflect changes, improving usability and clarity for end-users.

task.summary:
Add initial implementation of Tenable WAS Python client
This commit introduces the initial setup for the Python client library for Tenable Web Application Scanning (WAS) APIs. Included are basic API methods (`search_configs`, `search_scans`, `export_scan`), project configuration files, and documentation. The `.gitignore` excludes common Python and `.idea` files, and `pyproject.toml` defines project dependencies and metadata.

Refactor Tenable WAS client with class-based structure
Reorganized the Tenable WAS client to use a class-based design, encapsulating API methods within the `TenableClient` class for better modularity and reusability. Enhanced input validation, headers handling, and documentation formatting. Updated `README.md` and version to reflect changes, improving usability and clarity for end-users.
